items.shortText: Lakmal to Sabbir Rahman, no run
Lakmal to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: short of a length, opens the face to run it to third man
waits in the crease to a back of a length ball and drops it into the off side
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full, on the pads, flicked off them through square leg. That's a gift
items.postText: Major update filtering in. Hearing that Shakib could be out of the first Test. But we are still awaiting official word.
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, FOUR runs

items.text: cuts in from a back of a length, nudged into the leg side
items.shortText: Chameera to Sabbir Rahman, no run

items.text: oh, dear. Bangladesh are losing it here but what's worse is they're all getting out to atrocious shots. This is a short ball that really doesn't deserve a wicket. But of all the vast spaces at the Shere Bangla, he swivels into a pull that lands straight into the waiting hands of midwicket

dismissal.text: Sabbir Rahman c Gunaratne b Chameera 2 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 22.22

items.preText:
Mahmudullah. He has a penchant for the big occasion. Can he do something here and salvage Bangladesh?

jamal: "@Akshay: Think one of the only player in the BD lineup who does have the temperament to play and win matches for any country is Shakib. That's why he's one of the top allrounders across formats, getting picked for T20 sides and former cricketers' XI's all over. Shakib was the architect who batted superbly in that match against NZ. He isn't here today and BD are going to make that very visible, I fear." Hmm, let's see. Chance of a lifetime for a young gun to step up here, though.
items.text: short of a length, gets on top and drops it into the leg side
short of a length, nips away, backs away and gets out of the line
couldn't have got luckier there. Mahmudullah tentatively pokes at one that straightens from a back of a length and gets big, gets a feather of an edge through the vacant cordon
good length on off, defended into the off side
full outside off, driven into the covers
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.preText: Mahfuz rahman: "what is the problem with BD batsmen ? no one taking singles." Not sure that's a problem specifically for Bangladesh.
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short of good length, shapes away, left alone

items.text: tries to nudge a length ball and gets hit on the pad

items.text: back of a length, holds its line, left alone
items.shortText: Lakmal to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: presses forward to a length ball and opens the face to third man
good length on leg, nudged to midwicket
short of a length, keeps low, defended
items.postText: Anurag Garg: "A win here or there does not make BD a good team. It was very much visible in the last match that if thry allow SL to reach into finals, it would be near impossible for them to beat SL in final. Strategically Zimbabwe would have been their favourite opponent in the finals."

items.text: short, gets over middle and leg as the batsman arches his back
full on the pads, clipped to deep backward square leg
banged in halfway down and gets over middle and leg as the batsman ducks
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short ball, shapes up for a pull but sees that the bounce is considerable and doesn't want to risk it
items.shortText: Chameera to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: short of a length, outside off, opens the face and drops to point

items.preText: Mahin : "Seems like everyone was ready and waiting to bash Bd. It's not about one or two matches, Bd have been consistently doing well in Odis. So hold your horses, match ain't over yet. "
items.text: in the air and past the boundary. Short, gets width, gets on top and slaps it uppishly. Stays in the air for long but drops short of deep backward point running to his right and diving. The ball gets past him
items.postText: Hasan : "Played 50 matches and highest score 65(Our dashing batsman sabbir)"
